job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Have you ever wanted to work on something that really matters?  Is it important to you to help others live longer, more fulfilling lives?  The Health Strategic Initiatives team is focused on just that â€” enabling individuals to live a healthier, happier life through personalized and compelling products.  We are an experienced team of engineers, data scientists, doctors, designers, PMs, and business leaders.  We work in a collaborative and dynamic environment where we are constantly pushing ourselves to redefine the industry and create delightful user experiences.   Data is central to the success of our team.  We work in a tight feedback loop where data insights drive feature development and design as well as defining future strategy and products.  As a data engineer you contribution will be foundational to all we achieve. Developing ETL and debugging using Spark framework: PySpark/Spark Scala, Spark SQL, Spark UI  Implementing data transformation using Python  Experience with Unix-based command line interface and Bash scripts  Experience with workflow scheduling / orchestration such as Airflow or Oozie  Database development experience with Relational or MPP/distributed systems, experience w/ Postgres  Data visualization experience using Python or similar technologies  Experience with query APIs using JSON, ProtocolBuffers, or XML One of your main areas of contribution will be in the area of analytics tools and services to support analytics  Implement and maintain end-to-end data pipelines with structural understanding of data products  Developing tools to support analytics needs and facilitate analysis and insights  Create intermediate tables from raw data to support ad-hoc analyses and reporting  Develop and maintain data QA framework A background in computer science, mathematics, or similar quantitative field with a minimum of 3 years professional experience; Masters preferred    Role Number: 200275704
